intro.description: This cheat sheet guides you through the provisioning entities created by the design pattern.

item.title: Verify Data Schema: DesignPatternSchema
item.description: The data schema has a structure named inputMessage. This structure is used as the Input Message in the order recognition rule, and represents the incoming order. Other elements in the data schema include properties defined for the order item specification, like LineId and LineName.

item.title: Verify Role: admin
item.description: The role created by the design pattern has all of the permissions selected by default.

item.title: Verify Order: DesignPatternOrder
item.description:
Attributes that have been defined for the order item specification are added to the ControlData structure, which you can see in the Order Template tab.
Select the Details tab on the order to see the values for LifeCyclePolicy, Default Process, and Creation Task that have been populated.
Select the Amendable tab to view or set whether the order can be amended. If the order is amendable, before you can deploy the cartridge you must define a Key value in this tab for the order to be created successfully. You must replace the default value of true() in the Expression field with an XPath expression pointing to the data value on the order that is used to match the amendment order with the existing OSM order.
The Role that has been created and assigned to the order is shown in the Permissions tab.

item.title: Verify Order Lifecycle Policy: DesignPatternPolicy
item.description:
By default, the following transitions are enabled:
Completed > Update Order,
In Progress > Raise Exception,
In Progress > Update Order,
Not Started > Delete Order,
Not Started > Update Order

item.title: Verify Task: DesignPatternCreationTask
item.description: This manual task is used as the creation task for the order. The order item attributes have been added to the ControlData structure in the Task Data tab. The role is assigned to the task in the Permissions tab.
